title: Pier Luigi Bersani - Wikipedia
snippet: Pier Luigi Bersani (Italian pronunciation: [ˈpjɛr luˈiːdʒi berˈsaːni]; born 29 September 1951) is an Italian politician and was Secretary of the Democratic Party (PD), Italy's leading centre-left party, from 2009 to 2013.

title: Pier Luigi Bersani - La Regione e la sua storia - Regione Emilia-Romagna
snippet: Nasce a Bettola (Piacenza) nel 1951 · Si laurea in Filosofia a Bologna e compie una breve esperienza come insegnante. Consigliere regionale appartenente al Partito Comunista dal 1980 al 1986, viene eletto presidente della Regione Emilia-Romagna nel 1993 e riconfermato nel 1995 tra le fila ...

title: Democratic Centre (Italy)
snippet: Centro Democratico (CD) is a centrist political party in Italy, founded on 28 December 2012 by Bruno Tabacci and dissidents from prior centrist formations seeking to bolster the centre-left alliance led by Pier Luigi Bersani.[1] Under Tabacci's presidency, the party adheres to principles of democratic liberalism and social liberalism, as outlined in its statute, which emphasizes fidelity to the Italian Constitution and a rejection of rigid ideological confrontations in favor of fact-based governance.[2] Positioned as a moderate force, Centro Democratico has participated in various coalitions,
